I cannot separate this string and pass each `arg` into `args` because the string is generated by a `${command:...}`. However, if I pass the string directly as `command` into `tasks.json` with any of `weak`, `strong`, or `escape` quoting, the string as a whole will be quoted and produces `failed to launch (exit code: 127)` error.
Is there a way to execute the string __AS-IS__? Or is there a workaround?
I got it working by using `sh` as command and `""-c"", ""${command:...}""` as args, but this is ugly and not cross-platform.",,

119556,OPEN,createNotebookCellExecutionTask should not return undefined,,2021-03-23 15:20:33 +0000 UTC,jrieken,,"The `createNotebookCellExecutionTask` says that it returns undefined in case it is created for an invalid kernel. That makes it  more cumbersome to program against it and violates the createXYZ-function pattern. You could throw an error instead but I doubt that you can get either implemented correctly: kernel picking happens in the renderer and execution in the extension host. That mean you always have a window of invalid state and therefore the decision to ""block"" execution creation sync is prone for race errors.
Also, all of this is likely to change with upcoming kernel changes ",,
119555,OPEN,String characters after a newline are missing in VARIABLES pane,,2021-03-23 08:23:59 +0000 UTC,polinasok,,"```

We observe the following missing content in the VARIABLES pane while seeing the expected pretty-printed multi-line values in DEBUG CONSOLE, in hover and in Copy Value. This is surprising given the DAP's wording ""The variable's value. This can be a multi-line text, e.g. for a function the body of a function"". The multi-line text is hardly a valid option if it results in truncated display. Supposedly this was fixed/introduced based on https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/73845. It is not clear from that issue if the discrepancy between Variables Pane and other elements is intentional.

,,
119544,OPEN,Inconsistency in the execution API and Kernel Provider,notebook; notebook-kernel; under-discussion,2021-03-26 14:06:46 +0000 UTC,DonJayamanne,,`export function createNotebookCellExecutionTask(uri: Uri, index: number, kernelId: string): NotebookCellExecutionTask
Note how the `kernelId` is mandatory in the above API call.
However in `NotebookKernel` the `id` property is optional.
This automatically means the KernelId is no longer optional. Unless someone creates kernel and doesn't even use the execution cell task, seems unlikely.

119508,OPEN,Typing sometimes hangs until Alt+Tab,needs more info,2021-03-31 10:46:27 +0000 UTC,gudvinr,,"
Sometimes vscode just stops entering symbols while I'm typing in code editor.
You can move cursor up and down, interface is responsive but code input not working.
There's no specific action sequence that produces this behaviour that I can think of. E.g. key combination of some sort.
Since I am working with Go most of the time, it happens only with .go files.
But this just means that I can't test different languages just for sake of testing and there's no assumptions that Go extension is responsible for this.
Also I can't disable Go extension to test because it would decrease productivity to the bottom.
I am sure that focus is inside editor since cursor is blinking there and it doesn't work again if I click outside of editor and back (e.g. to terminal or workspace view).
Editor works again after I switch focus to another window using Alt+Tab.

- [ ] Revisit all internal usages of notifications and consider if they should be converted to modal dialogs if they require immediate user actions

However I have observer 100% CPU with basically all languages I use: Rust-analyzer, Pylance, cpptools and ESlint/Typescript. I'm guessing they're just buggy.

It's probably infeasible to fix all of those extensions, but it would be nice if VSCode at least worked around their bugginess. Currently the only effort it goes to here is the Process Explorer, but it usually doesn't even show these processes!
No mention of pylance there! In fact it's not even showing the right window - I have several open but it's showing some random window that isn't even focused. It should surely show all windows?
1. Fix the Process Explorer so it actually shows all windows & processes
2. Add a dedicated CPU usage view for language servers/extensions.
3. If a language server/extension is detected as using 100% CPU for more than a certain amount of time, show a notification with an offer to restart it.
4. If possible, add an option to throttle language servers/extensions (e.g. using `nice`).",,

119425,OPEN,Keep all settings (+Keybindings; +Snippits) in .code-workspace file.,feature-request,2021-03-22 10:26:05 +0000 UTC,altimmons,,Extensions, Roots,  Tasks, Launchers, are able to be loaded into a file for .code-workspace.
I would like to see- the last two settings, **Snippits**, and **Keybindings** rolled into this space.

This is desirable for two reasons- one- it rolls up all  my settings for a project into a single file - This is mostly a useful template to start another file, but it also allows me to collect customizations specific to _that_ project.
I use this because I use Code in several different ""contexts"", not a single one.  There is still, as I complained in my initial feature request, a simple way to switch contexts.
As an  implementation, you could make it excessively passive (as with extension recommendations) so much so that  its useless, but at least its saved there...
My principle goal is to be able to switch context easily.  This is a python project. Pull in python workspace file,  all those extensions load, keybindings, load, settings load, and tasks load.
The critical use case that is overlooked at this time, when suggesting a workaround for #4504 is when collecting tasks and assigning them keybindings.  They should be kept together.

119370,OPEN,Markdown preview scrolls down while typing in editor,,2021-03-20 11:17:54 +0000 UTC,magiblot,,
* Type text near the end of the document, e.g. line 708.

* Scroll the preview near the end of the document. Then go to Settings, search ""Markdown"" and keep toggling ""Markdown > Preview: Scroll Editor With Preview"" or ""Markdown > Preview: Scroll Preview With Editor"".
The preview will scroll up on each update, and so will the editor until the cursor is about to become out of sight.
To make the issue more evident, set `markdown.preview.scrollEditorWithPreview` to `false`.
The issue is reproducible even after disabling extensions with the `workbench.action.reloadWindowWithExtensionsDisabled` command.

2. Go to the source control pane. All subrepos should show up.
3. Close all but the first in the list.
5. All subrepos will reappear in the source control pane.

Connecting to on prem bitbucket server using Active Directory credentials
Connect successfully for the first time using a test AD account then change the password on the test account.
Try to do a new push via the Source Control GUI menu ""push"" option:
The push will fail due to invalid credentials. No dialog window is displayed to enter in the new password.
Work around: at the terminal/command line, a manual ""git push"" command will display a windows dialog asking for the credentials.

119263,OPEN,Help users use the search viewlet by providing a contextual reference,,2021-03-18 16:09:52 +0000 UTC,Tyriar,,"The basic idea is to use the existing error/warning/info popups but also for regex and blob syntax references:

If we did start using this UI element more we should consider how it can obscure the content/inputs underneath. A possible solution to this is to use `pointer-events: none` and then either hide it or set a low opacity on mouse hover. We could also link this to my proposal in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/115034#issuecomment-767592803 where ctrl+hover will force hovers not to hide and allow interaction.
This would help with the placeholder contrast issue and allow us to hide information when it's not relevant:

119243,OPEN,When uninstalling an extension; ask to also uninstall extensions that depend on it,extensions; feature-request,2021-03-21 12:02:24 +0000 UTC,fbricon,,"A user reported that he ""Cannot uninstall 'Language Support for Java(TM) by Red Hat' extension. 'Java Test Runner' extension depends on this."", but it's only one extension among many that depend on Java.

Rather than manually hunting down  those extensions to uninstall first (which itself is a daunting task, see #119242), the warning popup should provide a button to uninstall all those other extensions (and their dependants) as well.

119242,OPEN,Provide a way to list dependant extensions,extensions; feature-request,2021-03-19 11:32:31 +0000 UTC,fbricon,,"The vscode-java extension has quite an ecosystem of other extensions on its own. When trying to uninstall it, it'll fail because 'Java Test Runner' extension depends on it for instance. But Also the Java debugger, Project Manager for Java, Tools for Microprofile, Quarkus Tools...

At the moment, there's no way to know which extensions should be uninstalled first. I suggest the Extension view adds a new tab that lists all those dependant extensions, to make it easier to identify what to uninstall (or simply understand the extent one extension's reach).

119183,OPEN,[Feature] A setting with scope machine-overridable should be available even if only defined in a user setting file,config; feature-request,2021-03-29 09:21:15 +0000 UTC,thernstig,,It is common to jump between multiple Node projects, and many of us use project specific environment settings via tools such as https://direnv.net/, where we load the current node version per directory. If I cannot set `""eslint.runtime"": ""node""` in my user settings, it means I have to set it in the machine or project settings instead, which is not ideal when working on multiple machines.
The `machine-overridable` scope is the recommended scope for settings that point to executables. See https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-eslint/issues/1188#issuecomment-799498357",,

119171,OPEN,Debugger fails to attach to extension (localProcessExtensionHost.ts Could not find a free port for debugging?),debug; needs more info,2021-03-20 11:17:54 +0000 UTC,svArtist,,"Issue Type: Bug
When trying to debug an extension project, the debugger doesn't seem to attach:
- Breakpoints are never hit, even though the extension host is running past them
- Console output is not sent to the Debug Console (very annoying)
- When I close the test window, terminating the process, the debugger doesn't get notified and keeps running
- When I stop the debugger, the test window doesn't get notified and stays open
Reproduction uncertain, I'm having about a 95% failure rate trying to debug an extension, with no changes made; it simply works some of the time.
In the ""test window"", the Developer Tools console shows ""[Extension Host] Could not find a free port for debugging"" from localProcessExtensionHost.ts

I've tried specifying some random ports in launch.json, as suggested [here](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/85328#issuecomment-557670543), but to no avail (in fact, I get the Warning ""Property port is not allowed."")
Same with the latest insider build.
I'm new to VS Code and dealing with the node debugger, so I don't know what to look out for yet, I'm sorry if I'm missing something obvious in this first step.
I would, for example, like to change the settings with which the extension host tries to find that port:
`findFreePort(expected, 10 /* try 10 ports */, 5000 /* try up to 5 seconds */);` to increase the default 10 tries and 5 seconds, but I can't find any settings where this would be exposed.

119159,OPEN,Request package name change; FHS compliance.,,2021-04-07 15:24:19 +0000 UTC,enveezee,,

As you'll see in the FHS section 4.11 the directory /usr/share/ is for READ-ONLY, ARCHITECTURE INDEPENDENT, DATA FILES, not executable and library files that are compiled for a specific architecture and such. Even when using /usr/local/ you are still suppose to follow the normal rules under that directory binaries in /usr/local/bin/ shared architecture independent read-only data in /usr/local/share/, etc.. when building packages that do not adhere to these rules and lump everything into a non-conforming mess, they belong in /opt/package/ or /opt/provider/.

PLEASE consider fixing these things at some point, this program is amazing but it really abuses common Linux standards. Welcome to the open source world, believe it or not we're not all just a bunch of hippies who have no standards of practice. I for one am thrilled you've arrived and created some truly amazing things since I became a Windows(TM) refugee 20 years ago, but I have to ask this of you that you /try/ adopt the philosophy of ""When in Rome... Do as the Romans do.""",,

119110,OPEN,Prominently recommend language extensions for debugging,debug; under-discussion,2021-03-17 16:16:51 +0000 UTC,digitarald,,"**Problem**

If a user misses to install an important language extension that provides debugging (like python or java), the setup of _run & debug_ makes a lot less sense. The provided defaults in _""Select Environments""_ are all meant for JS and don't give any additional context.

In usertesting we saw most Java/Python users without the right extension give up on ""run & debug"", and one even try Chrome-debugging on a python file. None of them clicked on the nondescript _""More …""_ in _""Select Environment""_ (which opens the search for debugger extensions).
The _run & debug_ viewlet and setup prompt could use file and workspace recommendations to highlight a shortlist of extensions that the user should install to make debugging easier.
We could start with a small scope for Java, C++ and Python and run this as experiment.

119101,OPEN,Finalize icon contribution API,api-finalization,2021-03-16 16:25:26 +0000 UTC,aeschli,,The icon contribution point allow extensions to define a new icon by id, along with a default icon.

That icon id can then be used by the extension (or any other extensions that depend on the extension) at the places where [ThemeIcon]([ThemeIcon](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/e88863d191fed9c81a0087ff225ef7daf79c40b8/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L800)) can be used `new ThemeIcon(""iconId"")`, [markdown strings](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/e88863d191fed9c81a0087ff225ef7daf79c40b8/src/vs/vscode.d.ts#L2516) (`$(iconId)`) and as icons in certain contribution points.
Product icon themes can redefine the icon (if they know about the icon id)

In this example, an extension defines two new icon ids `distro-ubuntu` and `distro-fedora` along with default icon definitions. The icons are defined in an icon font at the given font character. The icon font is defined in  a new contribution point `iconFonts`.

,,
119097,OPEN,Allow extensions to contribute getting started content,api; api-proposal; feature-request; getting-started,2021-03-29 18:56:10 +0000 UTC,JacksonKearl,,We want to allow extensions to contribute items to the welcome page's getting started section:
""description"": ""Use this sample project to learn how to convert Markdown to HTML!""
""description"": ""To start, try opening an example folder that has been preconfigured for this tutorial. This is optional, but helps for following along!"",

""description"": ""Open a markdown file and click the \""Open Preview\"" button at the top of the screen to see a preview of your file. This is technically optional, but it updates live and is helpful to check when creating your content!"",

""description"": ""To create the html file, run \""Convert Document to HTML\"" from the editor actions context menu, behind the three dots top of the screen. This will create an .html file along side the markdown file."",

""description"": ""Test that everything worked by opening the .html file in your browser. First open the html file in vscode, then right click in the editor and choose \""Open in Default Browser\""."",
""altText"": ""use editor context menu to open an .html file in your browser""

""description"": ""That's all! You can share that single .html file with anyone without needing to bundle the images. To make this even easier in the future, consider adding a keybinding for the \""Convert Document to HTML\"" command."",
""altText"": ""use the keybindings editor to add a keybinding for this command""
This is the change to the extension contributions interface:

119089,OPEN,Add simplified notebook data provider,api; feature-request; notebook,2021-04-02 16:11:09 +0000 UTC,jrieken,,"Todays `NotebookContentProvider` is putting lots of responsibilities onto extensions. In return, it allows for notebooks that aren't stored on disk or are composed of multiple files (like a directory is a notebook). However, the internals that connect to the content provider assume that one notebook is one file. Making this assumption (once it is correctly implemented) makes the life of notebook extension authors much simpler: vscode can take care of file watching, concurrent write etc etc. However,  when the internals take soo much responsibilities than the current API is too complex: it can be a simple as converting bytes to notebook data and vice versa.
This issue is about adding such a new simplified API. This is the proposal

119027,OPEN,Unable to launch VSCode after macOS unexpected reboot,freeze-slow-crash-leak; needs more info,2021-04-07 17:31:21 +0000 UTC,peterflynn,,"
1. macOS unexpected crash (e.g. kernel panic, or battery dies... or possibly also scheduled/auto-reboot to install updates, see #110202)
2. When computer reboots, it tries to restore / reopen all apps that were open before the crash
3. Click VSCode icon to launch it
Result: Dock icon bounces for a second, then immediately closes again. Looks like VSCode is crashing on launch.
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
[main 2021-03-15T23:05:13.635Z] Sent env to running instance. Terminating...
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported direct to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
1. Open Activity Monitor and kill the process generically named ""Electron""
2. Verify that any ""Code Helper"" & ""Code Helper (GPU)"" processes have disappeared after this
3. Relaunch VSCode the normal way (e.g. from Dock icon)

This appears to be the same issue as #81970, where a number of comments at the bottom are expressing confusion about how to apply the workaround – but I can't comment there to clarify the workaround since it's locked 😢

It wasn't explicitly mentioned there that you have to kill a process called ""Electron,"" and if you interpret the workaround as killing processes named ""Code"" then you get into an infinite whack-a-mole trying to kill the lingering ""Code Helper"" & ""Code Helper (GPU)"" processes – they change PID every few seconds. Even if you multi-select in Activity Monitor and Force Quit all of them at once, more are respawned a moment later.

**However,** regardless of the workaround I believe this is a real bug that should be kept open.  OS reboots are not _that_ rare, and if it's common for VSCode to inexplicably become un-launchable afterward, that really should be fixed.
(#22449 and #110202 seem likely to be other reports of this this same issue as well. _Possibly_ #8119, #18521 too).",,

119022,OPEN,uninstalling an extension does not clear its globalState or workspaceState,extensions; feature-request,2021-03-16 17:31:55 +0000 UTC,felix9,,"
This is an example using the prettier-vscode extension.
2. open a nodejs project that has prettier installed in node_modules
4. Prettier will ask ""Do you allow the execution of this Prettier version""
at this point, prettier-vscode has set a value `PRETTIER_MODULE_ALWAYS_ALLOWED: true` in its globalState.
prettier-vscode state is still in globalState:
9. `sqlite3 state.vscdb 'select * from ItemTable where key like ""%prettier%""'`
if I re-install prettier-vscode, it will use the previously saved state.
this makes it hard to do a ""clean reinstall"" of an extension without doing a clean reinstall of vscode itself.
(certainly, individual extensions could clean their state for you, but I think in general there should be an easy way to clean the state of an arbitrary possibly-buggy extension)",,

119005,OPEN,Support link detection in notebook error output,feature-request; notebook; notebook-output,2021-03-16 08:36:55 +0000 UTC,DonJayamanne,,"@nfx commented on [Sat Feb 27 2021](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/issues/4973)
Let's imagine some hypothetical bad code that resulted in exception either because bad or unfamiliar third-party libraries and focus on speed of issue resolution:

Upon executing this, we get an exception. As professional IDE user, I expect a consistent behavior and exception stack trace rendered like a normal stack trace - something compact, with clickable lines, that get me to correct lines of code, causing the error. I do not want to open search bar in the project, then figure out that this is not the error in the project i'm working on, but rather in third-party dependency, because that way i have to go, figure out where the sources of that dependency are, open another editor, find references, etc etc. I also really don't want to see the same exception message for 3 times. Practically speaking, we can make hiding of stack traces as opt-out feature. If make with bottom-right notifications popup - even better :)

VSCode has a nice stack trace rendering widget in debug mode, so that one could be just re-used in this beautiful extension, so that I'd see consistent UX across different parts of the editor for the same type of things.
Thanks for the feedback @nfx. Possible dupe of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-jupyter/issues/4589

,,
119004,OPEN,Join Cells with multiple selections,feature-request; notebook; notebook-multiselect,2021-03-17 00:55:36 +0000 UTC,rebornix,,
## Run action on all selected cells
The simplest solution is merging all selected cells into one. It's intuitive as all cells in the selections will be merged, which is never ambiguous.
Imagine we have a notebook with 5 cells
Python cells 1, 2, 3 and 4 are selected, so we have 2 distinct selections, `{ start: 0, end: 2 }`, `{ start: 3, end: 5 }`. After users run Join Cells:
Each distinct selection shrinks into a single cell.",,

118995,OPEN,Mac OS X Speech tool for text-to-speech fails after first use,accessibility,2021-03-15 19:04:36 +0000 UTC,ivanistheone,,"
Default mac os dictation dictation tool (part of Accesibility) stops working after first use.
1. On a Mac OS X computer, add a keyboard shortcut for the text-to-speech accesibility tool
check this doc for more info about [using built-in mac text-to-speech](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1mApa60zJA8rgEm6T6GF0yIem8qpMmnaBFYOgV32gdMc/edit).

2. Open vscode on any project that contains text (e.g. a markdown file), select a paragraph and press the keyboard shortcut defined in step 1 (CMD+OPTION+CTRL+L in my case) and you will hear the computer read the text to you.
3. Select another paragraph and press the keyboard shortcut again
**EXPECTED**: computer to read the text again, like in step 2
**OBSERVED**: a ""terminal bell"" sound is heard and nothing happens (no error printed even when running in --log=debug mode)
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

118947,OPEN,Search editor: leverage text file model support and behave like normal text editors,debt; important; search-editor,2021-04-06 05:50:13 +0000 UTC,bpasero,,"In the context of https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/117873 I was doing a quick research how working copy providers that are text file model based are implemented today and found 2 examples:
When you look at `CustomTextEditorModel` you can see how every IO related method (like `save` or `revert`) is going into the manager of text file models, e.g.:
This has the advantage that a lot of corner cases for saving are being taken care of that prevent data loss or corruption.
When looking at search editors, I see that a (code editor) model is being resolved or created here:
But the IO logic is all implemented custom, e.g.:
As such, your custom search editor is a good candidate for adopting the text file model approach, similar to custom text editors.
I am inclined to mark this `important` because I think you really should not implement the IO logic yourself, but maybe there are no issues with your implementation either, so I leave it as `debt`.

118938,OPEN,Error when trying to rename or delete folder with git repo inside,,2021-03-20 11:17:53 +0000 UTC,Shaddaaa,,"Issue Type: Bug
1. Open some folder A with VSC
2. Create a new folder B inside that folder A.
3. Initialize a new empty git repository inside folder B.

4. Try to delete or rename B from inside VSC. Either through the VSC-Explorer or through the embedded command line tool. Rename will fail completely, resulting in a permission error. Deleting is not able to move to recycle bin, only deleting permanently. Elevating permission level to admin does not fix the issues.
1. Dialog asking if I'm sure I want to delete? (I click yes)
2. Win-Dialog saying that access was denied, it needs elevated permission. (I grant permission)
3. typical Win-Dialog to give VSC admin permission (I grant permission)
4. Dialog saying deletion failed, asking if I want to permanently delete instead.
I tried integrated powershell, terminal and right click folder -> rename, all fail inside of VSC.
Strangely deleting and renaming do work if I do them fast enough after starting VSC, while it is still loading my folder I assume?
On the other hand using the Windows Explorer or the Windows Terminal to delete or rename works flawlessly, without any need for admin permissions.
My guess would be it's something about Source Control doing weird things?

118932,OPEN,Closing Bracket indentation doesn't work for some languages,,2021-03-15 08:00:43 +0000 UTC,OmriSoudry,,Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported direct to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
**Expected:** When you type ""End If"", the indentation will go back to the same level as the opening block (""if""), as can be seen above.
**Actual:** The ""end if"" stays in the wrong indentation level:
I found out that this can happen in all programming languages where a closing tag includes the opening tag as a separate word (For example: _If ... End If_, or _While ... End While_).

**Solution:** This is related to the order of the pieces as defined in [these lines of code in the richEditBrackets.ts file](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/a699ffaee62010c4634d301da2bbdb7646b8d1da/src/vs/editor/common/modes/supports/richEditBrackets.ts#L228)
- If you change the order so that first the **closing** brackets would be pushed and only then the **opening** brackets, then it will work.
- Alternatively, you can modify the _createBracketOrRegExp_ function and just add a reverse() function there.

I'm not sure if it will mess things up or not (though my initial tests look promising) and I'm not too familiar with the code to change it myself and issue a PR, so please take a look and let me know what you think.

I have these top/bottom padding settings enabled because I don't like the top or bottom of my code jammed up against the UI or the bottom of the window, and when I use the keyboard to ""go to the top"" or ""go to the bottom"" I mean both ""put the cursor on the first/last line"" and ""scroll maximally in that direction"".
2. Scroll to the top with the mouse (120 padding shows — good).
3. Scroll to the bottom with the mouse (120 padding shows — good).
4. Press the key command to scroll to the top of the document (⌘-↑ on macOS... presumably ""Home"" on Windows?).
5. Note that the first line is at the top of the viewport, with no 120 padding.
6. Press the key command to scroll to the bottom of the document (⌘-↓ on macOS... presumably ""End"" on Windows?).
7. Note that the last line is at the bottom of the viewport, with no 120 padding.

118851,OPEN,Debian freezes repeatedly: vscode + nvidia driver,,2021-03-20 11:17:53 +0000 UTC,RossBoylan,,
I recently installed VSCode and julia, including the julia extension for VSCode, onto a Debian GNU/Linux buster system with nvidia proprietary drivers.

Since then the system has repeatedly become unresponsive, often while working in vscode.  This includes repeated times I had to restart the computer, as well as ones for which I was able to recover.  Unfortunately, the failure is not deterministic as far as I can tell.

This morning I had a near fatal experience; I got back enough control to enter a text mode terminal, kill some competely unrelated processes, and  watch responsiveness slowly restored.  When I came back to my main desktop with VSCode, the contents of both the Julia REPL and the bash shell inside of VSCode that I had been using had been replaced by a few stray colored lines.  Scrolling around or highlighting and selecting did not bring anything more back.
This afternoon, while in emacs, it entered some loop consuming more memory, and I had to restart the computer.

Here are some entries in the kernel log.  Note repeated entries this morning involving failures from code's invocation of  libnvidia-glcore.so.418.181.07.  I've included stuff from the harder failure this afternoon, although it has no references to code or nvidia.
Mar 12 09:49:01 barley kernel: [568086.087117] iftop[6190]: segfault at 0 ip 000055806e6d2749 sp 00007fff08171780 error 4 in iftop[55806e6ce000+9000]
Mar 12 09:50:43 barley kernel: [568188.661767] code[6555]: segfault at 10 ip 00007fd8d08c9a10 sp 00007ffc6d6bbfe0 error 4 in libnvidia-glcore.so.418.181.07[7fd8cf9d1000+1220000]
Mar 12 09:50:46 barley kernel: [568191.621443] code[6619]: segfault at 4 ip 00007fd8d09adb07 sp 00007ffc6d6be7a8 error 6 in libnvidia-glcore.so.418.181.07[7fd8cf9d1000+1220000]
Mar 12 15:27:05 barley kernel: [588369.436970] Web Content invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x6200ca(GFP_HIGHUSER_MOVABLE), nodemask=(null), order=0, oom_score_adj=0
Mar 12 15:27:19 barley kernel: [588369.436971] Web Content cpuset=/ mems_allowed=0
Mar 12 15:27:31 barley kernel: [588369.436974] CPU: 4 PID: 9068 Comm: Web Content Tainted: P           OE     4.19.0-14-amd64 #1 Debian 4.19.171-2
Mar 12 15:27:39 barley kernel: [588369.436974] Hardware name: Gigabyte Technology Co., Ltd. Z390 DESIGNARE/Z390 DESIGNARE-CF, BIOS F6 03/14/2019
In case it's not in the system info, hardware is

column1: 118850,OPEN,No crash report is generated for our extension's cpptools-srv child process,confirmation-pending; electron; upstream,2021-03-23 21:39:50 +0000 UTC,sean-mcmanus,,"

1. Issue https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/20234#event-4452251253 referred me to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Native-Crash-Issues#creating-and-symbolicating-local-crash-reports so I followed those steps, i.e. run `""code --crash-reporter-directory <absolute-path>"" `

3. Do the repro steps at https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/7085, which are ""git clone https://github.com/thedmd/imgui-node-editor"", open imgui_node_editor_internal.h, click the ""Link"" identifier on line 739. That should cause VS Code to launch cpptools, which in turn launches cpptool-srv (which crashes).
4. Wait for it to crash -- it'll need to out-of-memory (so you should see memory increasing by the GB).
Bug: No crash report is generated at the crash-reporter-directory-folder (it gets populated with some other files by VS Code).

column1: 118838,OPEN,Dialog windows appear on different screen when using second monitor,,2021-03-13 15:16:30 +0000 UTC,DarrenCook,,"Electron: 11.3.0
1. Have vscode running on a second monitor.
2. Do any action requiring a pop-up dialog, such as File
column4: About. It opens on the first monitor.

column1: I've also tried dragging the dialog across to the second monitor, in the hope that it would then memorize the monitor. But the next dialog still opens on the first monitor.
This is a pain, because I've been turning the screen off on my notebook while using the second monitor.

This is an exact duplicate of #104550, which says that upgrading to the ""latest stable"" as of Nov 2020 fixed it. But I've just upgraded from 1.53.2 to 1.54.2 and it made no difference. (Also disabling all extensions and restarting made no difference.)
That issue was locked so I was forced to start this new issue. I don't know if it was fixed and then broke again? Maybe @rhaschke can comment, and we can try and narrow down the system differences.
* It still happens whether the app is normal of maximized.

* I have the notebook monitor set to be ""primary"" display. If I swap this over so monitor 2 is the primary, then the behaviour is completely reversed. Now system dialogs open on monitor 2, whether I have vscode (or chromium) on monitor 1 or 2!
* Firefox does not have this problem, not does xed (so it is not all apps). Gimp always uses the notebook monitor (i.e. ignores the ""primary"" setting).
Is there any configuration option in vscode to control this behaviour? Or anything I can try?
If not, this might have to be marked as ""broken in upstream""?
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

118835,OPEN,Escape on multiple select may shrink to focus,feature-request; list,2021-03-22 16:29:47 +0000 UTC,rebornix,,

With the new `selectionNavigation` mode, users can easily go from single selection mode to multi selection by press shift+arrows. I would expect pressing `escape` key to revert back to single focus/selection mode but now it  clears focus and all selections. Something we can consider
* Escape will shrink selections to single focus/selection
* Another escape will then clear all selections + focus

118833,OPEN,Notebook output must support more ANSI sequences,feature-request; notebook; notebook-output,2021-03-21 16:36:01 +0000 UTC,jrieken,,"follow up from https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/116416#discussion_r593259173 and other discussions

Kernels often print stdout/stderr content with the assumption of being connected to a terminal. With that mindset they send ANSI sequences. Some of those sequences we support, like colors. We current don't support the sequence that clears the screen and that forces the jupyter extension to employ funny workarounds: they scan all output for that sequence, remember that so that they can clear the output before appending the next chunk. Things would be much simpler for them if we would simply support that ANSI sequence. ",,

118829,OPEN,Add `multipleSelectionSupport` to `IWorkbenchAsyncDataTreeOptionsUpdate`,feature-request; list,2021-03-22 16:28:13 +0000 UTC,alexr00,,Extension provided tree views are in a tricky state right now.

On one hand we need to make sure that all the tree properties are set correctly, like multiple selection support. This can only be set after the extension has activated. However, waiting for all extensions to activate in response to `onView` might be slow and is hard to wait for.
On the other hand, extension trees are now created too eagerly (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/117679), which was originally done to solve the first problem.
If `multipleSelectionSupport` can be updated, then this solves all problems. ",,

118817,OPEN,Config options to turn off specific features provided by built-in `markdown-language-features`,feature-request; markdown,2021-03-12 20:01:14 +0000 UTC,artempyanykh,,As a result the symbols get duplicated:

I don't want to fully remove symbols functionality from the server as Emacs or Vim don't have the built-in symbols support for markdown. 118809,OPEN,Source control window showing many modifications,,2021-03-12 10:22:24 +0000 UTC,jms19,,I have just installed VSC, opened a couple of files by their UNC paths but the source control left bar icon indicates ""96 pending changes"" and clicking on it shows the source control window showing (source) files in the same and parallel working directories. Some with a ""U"" but most ""M"". I have in fact edited about a dozen files which are listed but do not stand out at all. The others listed haven't been touched for several years. If I restrict my investigation to one particular short file (which is checked in but untouched for years) I see a scroll-sychronised matching pair of windows of that file.
The output window shows that for one particular 14 line script it does
At least it hasn't gone and actually staged stuff without asking which is what Atom did when I tried it a few years back.
I am baffled as to why it thinks I have modified files. If I point TortoiseGit at the same UNC (rather the parent working directory) it does correctly interpret things.

,, 118787,OPEN,EULA ID dated 2018 in 1.54.2 installer (downloaded today),,2021-03-20 11:17:53 +0000 UTC,PDeBonte,,Issue Type: Bug
1. Go to the [""Download Visual Studio Code""](https://code.visualstudio.com/Download) page
2. Click the Windows button (= User Installer) or the ""System Installer"" ""64 bit"" button
4. When the EULA is displayed, scroll to the bottom
5. Note on the last line: ""EULA ID: Visual Studio Code 14 November 2018""

- With the exception of formatting and trivial URL changes (e.g. master vs. main in the GitHub URL and http vs. https in some other URLs), the installer EULA seems to be a match to [latest EULA on the website](https://code.visualstudio.com/license), which is required to download the installer (""By downloading and using Visual Studio Code, you agree to the license terms and privacy statement."")

- In contrast, it seems much less similar to a [2018-11 EULA that I found on Archive.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20181111155202/https://code.visualstudio.com/License), so I’m presuming that the 2018 “EULA ID” string is erroneous.

118783,OPEN,Support notion of restarting Notebook kernels,feature-request; notebook; notebook-kernel,2021-03-26 22:37:57 +0000 UTC,DonJayamanne,,"Basically the kernel restart is used to kill the old dead/hung/unusable kernel and start with a whole new kernel (with new state).

Feels like 2 extensions are already doing their own thing, and Julia will be the 3rd.
Hoping fo a common UI element with a corresponding method on the kernel `restart?(): Promise<void>`

118751,OPEN,Need to be able to specify view type for vscode.notebook.openNotebookDocument,api; notebook; under-discussion,2021-03-21 16:36:51 +0000 UTC,daytonellwanger,,"Previously this was supported, but it looks it was [decided to be dropped](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/93265#issuecomment-795417139).

I was using this functionality in the Live Share extension to get notebook contents from the host when the guest opens a notebook document that the host doesn't yet have open. The notebook should be opened with the content provider that the guest selected (if it's not already open on the host).

In general, there needs to be a programmatic way to open a notebook document, and part of that is specifying the view type. I imagine there are other scenarios where an extension would want to open a notebook behind the scenes and not prompt the user to select a content provider. This isn't possible without being able to specify the view type.

118731,OPEN,Investigate how to avoid Safari's popup-blocker when opening browser windows and tabs asynchronously,debug; web,2021-03-25 16:12:30 +0000 UTC,weinand,,When opening a new browser window or tab from a call back, Safari blocks that.
We probably need to use the suggested fix/workaound when opening the debuggee window in VS Code.
The tricky challenge is that for extension debugging the request for opening a new tab for the debuggee comes as a call back from the debug adapter/extension.

And the only user action (where the tab could be created without running into the popup blocker), is the ""Start Debugging"" (or ""F5"") action. But for this action VS Code does not really know upfront that a new tab will be needed...

In theory we could always create a tab (without bringing it to front) when starting extension debugging. And if js-debug calls back into VS Code for launching the debuggee, we would populate the tab and bring it to front. And if no call back is received within some period of time we would close the unnecessary tab.",,

118730,OPEN,Create smoketest asset,engineering,2021-03-11 14:57:20 +0000 UTC,joaomoreno,,"It would be cool to publish the built smoketest into our storage account, for every commit. That way we don't have to locally checkout the smoketest when running against a specific build: the smoketest script can simply detect the commit of the target build, download that specific smoketest package from CDN into disk and just run the smoketest.
- [ ] Make sure the smoketest gets packaged into an asset and published to our builds page
- [ ] Update the `yarn smoketest` script to detect the commit when using `--build` and use it to download the smoketest package from our CDN and run that instead of running out of sources",,

118726,OPEN,Allow extension-owned terminals to opt out of being a persistent terminal,api; api-proposal; feature-request; integrated-terminal,2021-03-16 13:35:19 +0000 UTC,Tyriar,,"Currently we enable the persistent terminal/reconnect feature if a terminal is launched by an extension, unlike the env var relaunch where we disable outright because it can cause issues with the extension as it loses access to the terminal upon relaunch.

Relaunching the PowerShell extension right now for example is a bit of a weird experience though because it creates the ""PowerShell Integrated Console"", and that reconnects upon reload but is no longer managed by the extension.

118667,OPEN,Remove use of assert.equal from the code,debt; engineering,2021-04-01 15:31:50 +0000 UTC,lramos15,,"The code base currently uses a mixture of `assert.strictEqual` and `assert.equal` for mocha testing. However, `assert.equal` is deprecated meaning overtime it may break or cease to work. We also see ugly strike throughs in many of our tests. See https://nodejs.org/api/assert.html#assert_assert_equal_actual_expected_message for more info on the deprecation.
My suggestion is that we make an effort to remove all `assert.equal` use cases from our code base since it's been deprecated since version 9.9 of node. We currently have 3,697 uses of assert.equal.
- [ ] Remove deprecated asserts from built-in extensions.",,
118661,OPEN,Temp output of Write-Progress is not removed correctly and blends into the main output (making the output unusable),,2021-03-29 19:10:08 +0000 UTC,DEberhardt,,"Issue Type: Bug
1. Execute Script via CmdLine or Run that has Write-Progress in it.
2. Terminal output does not correctly remove the Progress. and leaves the ""overlay"" on screen leaving the output incomplete or worse incorrect.
Executing Write-Progress in the VsCode Integrated Terminal window leaves Progress window drawn in the terminal overlaying the actual output below.
First I thought that it occurs when followed by a `ForEach` where the Progress is written with the Same ID or one higher, but that is not the case.

Then I investigated whether my scripts are missing the `Write-Progress [...] -Completed` message at the end - they do not (even when they are missing (shame on me!) the windows are not correctly removed. Adding the `-Complete` Step at the end does not make a difference). The Progress window is expected to be removed. This behaviour is correct in PowerShell and PowerShell ISE, but not in VSCode.
Not all of them display the same behaviour though. My Module makes heavy use of Write-Progress to indicate, well, progress, especially for longer running tasks.
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported direct to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
Testing with Extension Bisect has yielded the following result:
- When opening a new window without Extensions (`code --disable-extensions`), the issue did not occur
- When then starting Extension bisect from this window and repeating it 7 times, the issue did not occur.
- When starting Extension bisect from the main window that currently exhibits this issue, it occurred at the first step (after disabling all extensions)
User Settings, Workspace settings are not used, nor are Folder Settings - these are all settings with the Word Terminal in it^^
I do not know why (when I start vscode) I have two integrated shells running, but both are v5 (which I need due to incompatibilities with v7)

,, 118630,OPEN,Keytar causes crash on Stable; but not Insiders?,,2021-03-23 14:21:00 +0000 UTC,marceau-maubert,,Issue Type: Bug
I don't know at which point this started happening, but starting an instance of Stable now crashes a few seconds after, with parameters `code --verbose -n` I get this:
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'char const*'

I figured out after looking through the issues that it might be related to Keytar and that there was a new command line parameter to turn it off, which did resolve the issue. My credentials are however no longer being saved, of course, so that's not really a nice solution, considering how Insiders works just fine somehow.

I'm not using Snap to install either. I tried upgrading `libsecret-1-0` manually since that seems to be something Keytar depends on and Ubuntu might be behind, but to no avail, and that was really just a shot in the dark.
Is this something on my end that I should fix? Is there any way I could get more useful information to debug?

118550,OPEN,Wrong path separator with Git Bash as integrated terminal,bug; integrated-terminal,2021-03-30 21:04:34 +0000 UTC,FStefanni,,
1. Select `git bash` as the integrated terminal type
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported direct to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

the issue is the following: since both variables (`${workspaceFolder}` and `${pathSeparator}`) are expanded with backslashes, the Git Bash terminal will not recognize the path, and therefore it will create a wrong directory (basically, a directory with the name ""C:\work\example\..\test_dir"").
So, to fix this issue, the variables should be expanded according with the used integrated terminal, or, as an alternative, there should be a manipulation method to get the path in the desired form.

The former approach is the simpler for user setup, but the latter is slightly more flexible, so implementing both is the most general approach to get an out-of-the-box solution (best user experience), which can be fine-tuned whether required.

,,

118511,OPEN,Default sidebar width should not trigger narrow mode for extensionsViewlet,bug; extensions; getting-started; ux,2021-03-24 16:09:41 +0000 UTC,digitarald,,The default sidebar width is dynamically calculated but ends up being 251px for most window sizes I tested. The `narrow` mode for the `extensionsViewlet` is triggered for ⪬ 300px.

While `narrow` is great for small spaces, it hides key information like the icon, rating and download numbers. For users who don't discover the resizing, important context is lost for extensions. I noticed this during my work on getting started, as it guides users early into the extension panel; which looks no very inviting without expanded.
- Add a size before narrow that allows more context like a smaller extension icon and simpler rating, or other redesign ideas.
Tooltips on descriptions to read cut off text.

118489,OPEN,ALT doesn't select the top menu in marketplace tabs,,2021-03-10 10:11:56 +0000 UTC,Hadakajime,,"

whilst reading ""Release Notes: 1.54.1"" I attempted to try pressing ALT to highlight the top menu. It doesn't work. Switching to a tab that is for an open file - then ALT works. Switching back to the relase notes - ALT doesn't work.
There should be consistency. ALT should highlight the top menu.
Unfortuntately, it seems the marketplace is given special treatment: ALT doesn't work; pages don't cache and instead refresh every time you switch tabs; etc etc.

Claiming that vscode is just an editor is farcical. This isn't notepad or gedit. It has a whole marketplace, it runs plugins and supports automation. It already implements chromium... why can't you simply cache a marketplace page? I can open multiple files of several thousand lines simultaneously, yet it refuses to cache a simple plugin description page? Why? Scared that it will have to use some precious RAM?

118422,OPEN,Make cli.contribution available in sandbox,debt; sandbox,2021-03-22 16:28:50 +0000 UTC,bpasero,,The [`cli.contribution`](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/dbf6147c01ed2554ec70b025a916d38d4204f2eb/src/vs/workbench/contrib/cli/node/cli.contribution.ts#L2-L2) is depending a lot on `node.js`. 118402,OPEN,Explore to convert extension Welcome pages to Getting Started,getting-started,2021-04-05 05:23:59 +0000 UTC,digitarald,,To further refine #118055, we need to convert some existing _welcome_ pages _(aka: anything that extensions pop up on a fresh install)_ to use the proposed getting started API. We expect that this migration can a) make start pages more contextual and timely, and b) provide organic discovery for extension content.
To start with, we are looking into extensions that have been coming up during usertesting:
- [x] First conversations: Ongoing work on an updated Welcome page that.
- [ ] Prototype the current Welcome content in Getting Started
- [ ] 💪 Docker ([Start page](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-docker/blob/main/resources/startPage.html.template) running as experiment right now)
- Opening files, build-in pages and projects without yanking users out of getting started
- Commands and flows that open new tabs need to be opened side-by-side with getting started.
- New projects currently open a new window. Could either open in current window (if empty) or with getting started restored.
- Most extension Welcome pages offer focus on the multiple ways to get started: _Open folder_, _Open file_, _New file_, _New file type x_ (from template), _Create project_ (from wizard), etc
- How do we expose in _Getting Started_, which follows a serial content pattern
- Contribute those entry points in Welcome page and Explorer",,

118375,OPEN,Proposed Notebook API: Request for 'onDidChangeNotebookOutputCellSelection' event.,api; feature-request; notebook,2021-03-08 16:19:05 +0000 UTC,pgfearo,,The `onDidChangeNotebookEditorSelection` event fires when an input or output cell is selected, giving information about the cell(s) selected.

I would however like, for a notebook output cell, the equivalent of the `onDidChangeTextEditorSelection` event. This fires when the selected range(s) change in the input cell editor, but not if there's a change in the selected range in the output cell.

My specific scenario: When an XPath cell is evaluated and returns XML nodes, an output cell with a mime-type of 'application/json' contains XPath locations for these nodes. If one of these XPath's is selected I would like to handle that event and highlight the corresponding location in an adjacent XML editor (see attached).

column1: 118361,OPEN,Debugging projects on mounted and linked folders not working,debug,2021-03-07 21:06:19 +0000 UTC,viktor-c,,"Hi everyone!
I have to post a new issue because this made me mad in the last days. I am running Linux and have simlinked a folder from another partition to my home folder for easy access. (Big mistake ! :)) )
I have created a simple electron app which I couldn't get to stop on set breakpoints. I would always get `breakpoint set but not yet bound`.
I downloaded an example app from github for electron and followed the tutorial and still not get it to break.
``` ""stopOnEntry"": true ```  it then eventually do break.

Back to my project it would also break but under ""loaded scripts"" it would not open my `main.js` file to debug and it wasn't bound. But I did see that it would open a `main.js` file with another path, using my absolute path.
This got me to this issue and comment from ghost https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/34627#issuecomment-437045319_

For further reference, if somebody has **linked folders** from **other partitions**, one must open the `vscode workspace file` and edit the relative path of the workspace or working folder to an absolute path.
This also occurs if your project is on a different partition and you have a symlink to the parent directory of the the project folder. vscode will follow the symlink path instead of the real path.
vscode will open a file using this path ~/projects/pro1/file instead of using the absolute path.
This prevents git markings from showing and you have to manually refresh the source control to see the changed files list.
My **work around** is replacing the project path from ""."" to the absolute path to the project in the workspace file:

column1: 118338,OPEN,Custom Extension Activity Bar Icon Disappears,bug; workbench-views,2021-03-24 16:09:50 +0000 UTC,doug-shontz,,"I am in progress of updating an extension.  The extension adds an activity bar icon to help manage a custom server I am creating.  I have had the extension on the marketplace for about a year with no issues with regards to the icon being used.
With the latest update, I find that, when I hit F5 to debug, the activity bar icon randomly ""disappears"" from the left sidebar.  I can pretty well duplicate it by doing the following:
- The icon will show up on the first time through.
- I close the Extension Development Host
- The ""spot"" where the icon is supposed to be still ""works"" (i.e. the action button still launches the extension), but the icon itself is blank
- Totally cleaning out my Code install and reinstalling from scratch so that there are no extensions or customizations.  Can reproduce still.
- Trying a number of different icons.  Same result.
- I did try going back one version (1.53).  Doing this fixed the issue and the icon never disappears with no change to my codebase at all.

I looked through the documentation and saw nothing that would indicate the requirements have changed for the icon and this is the one I've been using for a year, so I can only surmise perhaps something changed in this release?
Thanks in advance for any assistance!",,

118305,OPEN,Allow merging of changes in Resolve save conflict editor,feature-request; file-io; workbench-editors,2021-03-25 00:40:31 +0000 UTC,ferenczy,,- [2] _Accept Saved Content_
In the beginning, the _Accept Resolution_ button would be inactive.

The scope of the buttons [1] and [2] would be the currently select change (using the buttons _Previous_/_Next Change_) only. Pressing one of those buttons would mark the currently select change (i.e. conflict) as resolved and when all conflicts are resolved, the button [3] would become active allowing me to accept the resolution and save the resulting content into the file. That way, I can go through all changes one by one and quickly and easily accept or reject each one without manually copying and pasting changes back and forth.
What I have described is a standard feature of diff/merge applications, for example, KDiff3, WinMerge, Diffinity, etc. The buttons [1] and [2] are usually called _Copy Left_/_Right_.",,

118280,OPEN,Notebook API: Allow the kernel of a notebook document to be updated when executing a cell,feature-request; notebook-kernel,2021-03-26 14:04:57 +0000 UTC,rchiodo,,"

The current kernel is Python 3. However as soon as I execute any code, we create a connection to the remote jupyter server (this is in our remote case) and the kernel is now a 'live' kernel (the first kernel in the list. It is based on the Python 3 kernel but is now running)

The current API (well as far as I can tell) only allows us to refresh the entire list of kernels. This may update the preferred kernel but it doesn't change the kernel currently active for this notebook.
We need to update it to the 'live' version.",,
118277,OPEN,select directory dialog mostly too faint to read,,2021-03-09 23:06:59 +0000 UTC,RossBoylan,,"

Fill in a respository to clone (https://github.com/anj1/ThinPlateSplines.jl.git).
Select Repository Location dialog comes up.  Most of the line are in a grey that is barely distinguishable from the white background.  See attached screenshot.

The entries in light grey are all files, as opposed to directories, and so I guess they are irrelevant to picking a directory.  If so, why not exclude them entirely?  As it stands, they take up space and, potentially, time if one tries to figure out what they are.  If you don't want to drop them, please make the legible.
I am not entirely sure what component is responsible for the dialog: base VS Code, the base support for git in VSCode, or the GitLens extension.

column1: 118276,OPEN,Support detaching terminal processes,debt; integrated-terminal,2021-03-19 13:40:11 +0000 UTC,Tyriar,,"We have a `Terminal: Attach to Session` command which attaches the orphaned remote processes, I think it would be good for testing in particular if we a command to enable detaching sessions. This would allow us to do something very similar to what happens on reload by detaching and attaching, greatly improving test coverage around terminal reconnection.

118275,OPEN,Support audio controls in Notebook Renderer,,2021-03-09 21:30:02 +0000 UTC,DonJayamanne,,"We (Jupyter Extension) can accept the PR, however this would mean the Jupyter extension now has a custom renderer for HTML.
And I'm not too keen on owning rendering all HTML content in Notebook renderers (I know VS Code has custom code to handle a lot of the HTML content, links, etc).
* Please can we re-visit this issue
* Is it possible to provide some way for the Notebook to override the preferred renderer based on the content?
* I.e. I'd prefer to always use the built in renderer for HTML
* However if VS Code will not support wav natively, then we can override the preferred renderer and use the one we ship.

118267,OPEN,VSCode 1.54.1 breaks spawned processes with cwd option,bug; confirmed; macos-big-sur,2021-03-26 09:36:35 +0000 UTC,jeremie-stripe,,"
2. A few of our extensions are failing to start because spawned shell script processes do not work
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No
We run a few extensions (including an LSP server) which essentially spawn an external process executing shell wrapper scripts and attempts to manipulate its standard IO.

Since upgrading to 1.54.1 we have noticed a strange behavior where when writing to the external process stdin we get `EBADF` error. This seems specifically to only occur when attempting to execute shell script directly as when we modify the spawn (or similar functions) to invoke the script via `bash` directly it works fine.
This is illustrated by the following test cases executed while debugging VSCode:
Where `wrapper.sh` ultimately will `exec` the rest of the command line.

,, 118240,OPEN,On macOS; middle click selection paste should work in VSCode's integrated terminal to match macOS's standard Terminal,feature-request; integrated-terminal,2021-03-05 22:30:48 +0000 UTC,davidbsaltzman,,Issue Type: Feature Request

I've been loving the convenience of VSCode's built-in terminal, but I keep trying to select text and middle-click-paste like I'm used to on Mac's standard Terminal app (out of habit and since it's often useful), but it doesn't work.

It would be great it middle click selection paste were implemented in VSCode's integrated terminal on Mac. a) for consistency with the standard standalone Mac Terminal app, and b) because it's a useful feature that speeds up a lot of tasks.

Also note that middle click selection paste doesn't go through the usual cmd+c/cmd+v clipboard; it's valuable that it doesn't overwrite that. Also note that unlike Linux, on Mac middle click selection paste is a terminal-specific feature, not an OS-wide feature. So for consistency with general Mac patterns, ideally this would be enabled in the integrated terminal but not in the text editor.

118201,OPEN,Move native task dependencies out of renderer into shared process or extension host,sandbox; tasks,2021-03-31 13:54:39 +0000 UTC,bpasero,,We need to remove node dependencies of the renderer for our sandbox effort. Tasks are currently depending on node.js from the renderer (via `vs/workbench/contrib/tasks/electron-browser/taskService` et al). Going forward, we should move this into one of the processes that is allowed to execute node:

Filing this to get a discussion starting how to tackle this. With terminals moved, @Tyriar and @meganrogge have demonstrated that the shared process is a viable host for native processes and the patterns used for terminals can be applied to this one as well.
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/116337 has a diagram for how the shared process today is being used as host for privileged processes.",,

118200,OPEN,Move search app out of renderer into shared process or extension host,sandbox; search,2021-03-08 19:36:50 +0000 UTC,bpasero,,"We need to remove node dependencies of the renderer for our sandbox effort. Search is currently a process that is triggered from the renderer (via `vs/workbench/services/search/electron-browser/searchService` et al). Going forward, we should move this into one of the processes that is allowed to execute node:

Filing this to get a discussion starting how to tackle this. With terminals moved, @Tyriar and @meganrogge have demonstrated that the shared process is a viable host for native processes and the patterns used for terminals can be applied to this one as well.
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/116337 has a diagram for how the shared process today is being used as host for privileged processes.",,

118187,OPEN,Reading some files with NVDA can crash both NVDA and Vs Code,accessibility; bug; upstream; upstream-issue-linked; windows,2021-03-08 13:17:44 +0000 UTC,Neurrone,,"/CC @isidorn
I'm unsure if this is an NVDA or a Vs Code bug, so have also cross-posted in nvaccess/nvda#12125
1. Copy the contents of [crash.txt](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/files/6089611/crash.txt) into a new document in Vs Code
2. With NVDA running, press ctrl+end to go to the bottom, and press up arrow to read upwards.
Expected: it says `}`, as that is the end of the JSON output.
Actual: it read some data that belongs to lines further up. I think this is caused by that underlying chromium bug that prevents long files from being read properly.
More critically, it causes Vs Code to hang and NVDA to also hang as well. The only way to recover is to force kill Vs Code, which could be difficult if NVDA hangs as well.

118150,OPEN,vscode-typescript temp files still not deleted properly,help wanted,2021-03-18 00:42:54 +0000 UTC,ariccio,,
1. Use vscode under heavy system load on Windows.
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported direct to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
I'm opening this as a tracking type bug. My `vscode-typescript` temporary files are still not *reliably* being deleted despite the change in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/73801

I strongly suspect this is because of an almost universally common mistake seen in rimaf - almost nobody ever actually deletes files correctly on windows, it's not obvious at all how to do it correctly unless you know how the windows filesystem works inside the kernel - that I've already filed a bug for:
I do not recommend vscode fixing this issue itself.",,

column1: Having a vertical scrollbar in the Notebook Output Cells when contents exceed a certain value.
- Jupyter: Enable Scrolling For Cell Outputs (TRUE)
- Jupyter: Max Output Size (100, Default was 200)
Jupyter settings related to output cell scrolling seem to be ignored.
No scrollbar is added to a long output cell (must use the main scrollbar to scroll all the way down to the next input cell).
Values from 0 to 1000 printed to output, but without scrollbar in the output cell.
Results in an output that is over 4 pages long.
(Scrollbar visible in GIF is the main document scrollbar, what I want is an individual Output Cell scrollbar)
> Jupyter settings related to output cell scrolling seem to be ignored.
Thanks for filing this issue. Unfortunately the new Notebook in Insiders does't respect all of the settings. We'll try to get this functionality in.

118088,OPEN,Can't call createSyncDescriptor for service with more than 8 dependencies,debt; help wanted,2021-03-21 16:35:43 +0000 UTC,roblourens,,"I added a service injection dependency to some class and ended up with a very confusing TS error from a line that called `createSyncDescriptor`. It turns out that you can't call it for a service with more than 8 dependencies because of how `CreateSyncFunc` is defined. It's not a problem for me anymore because that function is barely used anywhere and I just changed to using the SyncDescriptor constructor directly. I wonder whether we should delete it or fix the definition of `CreateSyncFunc` to have a definition that takes arbitrary #s of arguments, but I don't know what the intent of this code is. You touched this at some point @jrieken maybe you know something about it.

Which will then create someName.code-workspace in the current directory and it will then open said workspace in VS Code. Like usual, someName.code-workspace will contain the following:
Perhaps one could set the path like so:
Which would then create the workspace file in the MyProject directory, of course. This for cases where you're not actually in the project directory when running the command.

118063,OPEN,Ask the user whether a custom editor should be made the default,custom-editors; feature-request,2021-04-01 16:00:38 +0000 UTC,Tyriar,,Was having a discussion with @kieferrm and we were thinking the extension should not say it should be the default, but rather indicate that it makes sense and would like to be the default. That way VS Code can ask the user when one of these default extensions is installed when opening a supported file whether it would like to be the default (eg. Luna Paint), but not for ""secondary"" custom editors where that doesn't make as much sense (eg. Hex Editor).
This will help if we recommend installing Luna Paint from the image viewer (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/116120) as the default wouldn't be changed out from under the user.",,

column1: 118050,OPEN,Search editor should continue searching when switching tabs,bug; search-editor,2021-03-29 21:42:48 +0000 UTC,anthonyvdotbe,,"
1. open a search editor, do a search & let it finish
2. do another search, but before it finishes switch to another tab (or open a new file)
3. switch back to the search editor
There are several issues, as demonstrated in the demo below.
1. when entering the search query `maven`, the name of the search editor's tab isn't updated
2. when switching to another tab, the blue bar keeps running, which gives the impression that the search is continuing in the background
3. when switching back to the search editor eventually, the search query has reverted to the original value
4. also, even after switching back, the blue bar still keeps running, and it takes a long time before it disappears & the user realises that their search query hasn't executed
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

118004,OPEN,Bash variable substitution using VS Code variable lead to no substitution,bug; variable-resolving,2021-03-25 14:08:19 +0000 UTC,moocan,,"
1. Create simple task with as command in task.json (unquoted or quoted):
Unquoted: `""command"":  ""shopt -s globstar; for prjfile in ${workspaceFolder}/**/*; do echo ${workspaceFolder}; echo ${prjfile//${workspaceFolder}/.}; done""`
Quoted `""command"":  ""shopt -s globstar; for prjfile in \""${workspaceFolder}\""/**/*; do echo \""${workspaceFolder}\""; echo \""${prjfile//\""${workspaceFolder}\""/.}\""; done""`

3. Variable substitution `${prjfile//${workspaceFolder}/.}` is not made when you call `${workspaceFolder}` directly in the substitution or using a VisualStudio Code variables as `${workspaceRoot}` too.
`> Executing task: shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=/myfolder/project-test; for prjfile in /myfolder/project-test/**/*; do echo /myfolder/project-test; echo ${prjfile//${workspaceFolder}/.}; done <`

Testing directly with `bash -c ""shopt -s globstar; workspaceFolder=""myfolder""; for prjfile in \""\${workspaceFolder}\""/**/*; do echo \""\${workspaceFolder}\""; echo \""\${prjfile//\""\${workspaceFolder}\""/.}\""; done""` is working
Use of `${workspaceFolder}` for the for loop and echoing it's value and using another variable for substitution.
`""shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=${workspaceFolder}; for prjfile in ${workspaceFolder}/**/*; do echo ${workspaceFolder}; echo ${prjfile//${prjFolder}/.}; done""`
`""shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=\""${workspaceFolder}\""; for prjfile in \""${workspaceFolder}\""/**/*; do echo \""${workspaceFolder}\""; echo \""${prjfile//\""${prjFolder}\""/.}\""; done""`
Launching task and substitution is done:
`> Executing task: shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=/myfolder/project-test; for prjfile in /myfolder/project-test/**/*; do echo /myfolder/project-test; echo ${prjfile//${prjFolder}/.}; done <`
Set the content of `${workspaceFolder}` to `prjFolder` and then use only this variable
`""shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=${workspaceFolder}; for prjfile in ${prjFolder}/**/*; do echo ${workspaceFolder}; echo ${prjfile//${prjFolder}/.}; done""`
`""shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=\""${workspaceFolder}\""; for prjfile in \""${prjFolder}\""/**/*; do echo \""${workspaceFolder}\""; echo \""${prjfile//\""${prjFolder}\""/.}\""; done""`
Launching task and substitution is done:
`> Executing task: shopt -s globstar; prjFolder=/myfolder/project-test; for prjfile in /myfolder/project-test/**/*; do echo /myfolder/project-test; echo ${prjfile//${prjFolder}/.}; done <`
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

117891,OPEN,Consolidate publishing builds to Azure,engineering,2021-04-06 12:19:40 +0000 UTC,joaomoreno,,"Until very recently, each build job was directly publishing builds to Azure Storage and CosmosDB. Recently, we made build jobs publish builds as build artifacts, such that it's straightforward for further jobs to download them and use them (ie test build jobs).

- [ ] Move all publishing to the [Release job](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/main/build/azure-pipelines/release.yml). It can simply download the builds as artifacts and upload them to Azure Storage and Mooncake and update CosmosDB. With this we can shave some seconds off each platform agent, since they wouldn't reach out to Azure Storage or CosmosDB.

- [ ] Remove all CosmosDB stored procedures in use. They were introduced due to issues surrounding concurrent writes to CosmosDB from multiple clients. Since we'd have a single client, this would be straightforward.

117885,OPEN,Shift key gets stuck on touch keyboard,accessibility; confirmation-pending,2021-03-02 20:34:52 +0000 UTC,vamsi-kleargroup,,"
Steps to reproduce are only for touch screen laptop. This issue happens only with touch screen keyboard in touch screen laptop.
1: Start writing a progam. Eventually you'll end up requiring to use the 'Shift' key.
2: Now switch to another application like chrome by clicking on the app icon in the taskbar. This happens sometimes without switching apps also.
3: You may notice if you type in search bar, all input will be capitalized as if 'Shift' was held down. Clicking on any other application opens up a new window.
PS: My hotkeys are turned off.
I have to restart my PC everytime  this happens. And it happens quite frequently (every 15 mins).

I have a major disability and use a [mouthstick](https://www.google.com/search?q=mouth+stick+stylus&safe=off&rlz=1C1CHBF_enIN914IN914&sxsrf=ALeKk005A0jE1dKxSj5R64Kz1d-3lQvYdw:1614599351093&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjZzpqmg4_vAhXJc30KHaqaCOoQ_AUoAnoECAIQBA&biw=1094&bih=446&dpr=1.25#imgrc=TZ-xVXugO6O9yM) to use my laptop and work as a full stack engineer. This issue has been quite disturbing for past 1-2 months. I really would appreciate and mean a lot if someone suggest a solution. VsCode is the only thing that allowed me to do programming as it supported most of my accessibility isssues like touch navigation and with some workarounds allows me to do my job.
